name: ASAP Rocky
description:
'''Rakim Athelston Mayers''' (born October 3, 1988), known professionally as '''ASAP Rocky''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|eɪ|s|æ|p}} {{respell|AY|sap}}; stylized as '''A$AP Rocky'''), is an American rapper, producer, actor, fashion designer and model. Born and raised in [[Harlem]], he embarked on his musical career as a member of the [[hip hop music|hip hop]] collective [[ASAP Mob]], from which he adopted his [[moniker]]. In August 2011, Mayers' single "[[Peso (song)|Peso]]" was [[music leak|leaked online]] and began receiving radio airplay within weeks, propelling [[cloud rap]] into mainstream attention. He signed with [[Polo Grounds Music]], an imprint of [[RCA Records]] in October of that year, and shortly after, released his debut mixtape, ''[[Live. Love. ASAP|Live. Love. A$AP]]'' (2011) to widespread critical acclaim.

Mayers' 2012 single, "[[Fuckin' Problems]]" (featuring [[Drake (musician)|Drake]], [[2 Chainz]] and [[Kendrick Lamar]]), marked his first entry—at number eight—on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], received a nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Rap Song|Best Rap Song]] at the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards]], and preceded his debut studio album, ''[[Long. Live. ASAP|Long. Live. A$AP]]'' (2013). A critical and commercial success, it debuted atop the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and received [[RIAA certification|double platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). His second album, ''[[At. Long. Last. ASAP|At. Long. Last. A$AP]]'' (2015), also debuted atop the chart and saw continued critical praise; its two lead singles, "[[Lord Pretty Flacko Jodye 2 (LPFJ2)]]" and "[[Everyday (ASAP Rocky song)|Everyday]]" (featuring [[Rod Stewart]], [[Miguel (singer)|Miguel]] and [[Mark Ronson]]), both received double platinum certifications by the RIAA, while its third, "[[LSD (song)|L$D]]", was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Music Video|Best Music Video]] at the [[58th Annual Grammy Awards]]. His third album, ''[[Testing (album)|Testing]]'' (2018), debuted within the ''Billboard'' 200's top five and garnered over 2 billion streams worldwide, while his highly anticipated fourth album, ''[[Don't Be Dumb]]'', is scheduled for release in 2025. Since his emergence in 2011, Mayers has accumulated over 17.5 billion streams for his music and 3.5 billion combined views on YouTube. As of 2025, Mayers remains one of the most popular rappers on Spotify. 

Aside from his musical endeavors, Mayers founded his multidisciplinary creative agency [[AWGE Label|AWGE]] in 2014. AWGE launched partnerships with [[Marine Serre]], [[Amina Muaddi]], [[Moncler]], [[JW Anderson]], [[Under Armour]], [[PacSun]], [[Vans]], [[Mercedes-Benz]], [[Selfridges]], as well as conceptual collaborations with [[MTV]] and Needles. The brand made its [[Paris Fashion Week|Paris Men's Fashion Week]] runway debut with its ''American Sabotage'' collection in 2024 and returned to Paris Fashion Week with its second show, ''Obligatory Fashion'' in 2025. Mayers co-launched cult fashion label ''VLONE'', co-chaired the [[Met Gala]] in 2025 and spearheaded campaigns for [[DKNY]], [[Calvin Klein (fashion house)|Calvin Klein]], [[Gucci]], [[Bottega Veneta]], [[Salvatore Ferragamo (company)|Ferragamo]], [[Beats by Dre]], [[Dior Homme]] and more. As of 2025, he serves as the creative director for [[Puma (brand)|Puma]] F1 and [[Ray-Ban]].

As an actor, Mayers portrayed critically acclaimed supporting roles in ''[[Dope (2015 film)|Dope]]'' (2015), ''[[Monster (2018 film)|Monster]]'' (2018), [[Spike Lee]]'s ''[[Highest 2 Lowest]]'' (2025) alongside [[Denzel Washington]], and ''[[If I Had Legs I'd Kick You]]'' (2025).

Mayers has received musical accolades such as a [[BET Awards|BET Award]], two [[BET Hip Hop Awards]], an [[MTV Video Music Awards Japan|MTV Video Music Award Japan]] and an [[MTVU#MTVU Woodie Awards|MTVU Woodie Award]]. His creative entrepreneurship has been rewarded with the [[Style Icon Asia|Global Style Icon Award]], the [[Virgil Abloh]] award, the [[The Fashion Awards|Cultural Innovator Award]], the [[Footwear News|Collaboration Of The Year Award]], and the [[CFDA Fashion Awards|Fashion Icon Award]]. He has been nominated for two [[Grammy Award]]s, six [[World Music Awards]], three [[MTV Video Music Award]]s and two [[MTV Europe Music Award]]s. Furthermore, Mayers has co-directed most of his own [[Music video director|music videos]], as well as worked in [[hip hop production|production]] or co-writing for other artists, often under the pseudonym Lord Flacko.
